newsitem.title: SWEDEN: FORECAST - AGA 9-mo seen 1.42 bln skr.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - AGA 9-mo seen 1.42 bln skr.

text.p: Swedish industrial gas producer AGA is expected to show a profit after financial items of 1.42 billion crowns for the first nine months of the year, a Reuter poll of 10 analysts found on Friday.
This would mean an 11 percent fall on the 1.60 billion crowns posted in the same 1995 period.
The forecasts ranged from 1.37 billion crowns to 1.46 billion, and exclude a 1.79 billion crown capital gain on the sale of shares in power producer Gullspang.

The consensus estimate for the year was 1.90 billion crowns compared with 2.11 billion for the full year 1995. Thus, the average forecast for 1996 has fallen by 300 million crowns since the last Reuter poll in August.
The negative effects of the stronger crown were behind the forecast downgrade, analysts said.
Profits in 1997 were seen at 2.20 billion crowns, and the average estimate for 1998 put the profit at 2.51 billion.
AGA is due to publish its nine-month figures on November 4.
Sources: Carnegie, Enskilda, Fiba, Goldman Sachs, James Capel, Kleinwort Benson, Matteus, Morgan Grenfell, Natwest,
